summary:
The New Deal was a big plan by President Franklin D. Roosevelt to help the United States during the Great Depression. From 1933 to 1938, the government created jobs, helped farmers, and supported the unemployed and the elderly. They also made new rules for banks and businesses to stop another depression.

This plan changed politics, making the Democratic Party very popular for many years. It also started a big argument between people who liked the new ideas and those who thought they were bad for business.
title: New Deal
